text:
Katy Perry literally brought the house down as she performed her new track Chained To The Rhythm with Skip Marley.
The American beauty, 32, put on a busty display in a pin-striped Versace suit with a plunging crop top as she sang the catchy pop tune.
A makeshift housing estate moved to the sound of the beat as Katy roamed between dancers inside the pop-up buildings.
All round the houses: Katy Perry literally brought the house down as she performed her new track Chained To The Rhythm with Skip Marley
Giant skeletons dressed as Donald Trump and Theresa May, after the Prime Minister's recent visit to the US, were introduced later on in the performance, with their operators skilfully propelling them to the centre of the stage.
Katy's performance wasn't quite incident free, however, as one of her backing dancers walked straight off the stage with their view seemingly impaired by the house which they were within.
Skip and Katy held each other's hands triumphantly aloft as the final notes rang out as the audience applauded.
A job well done: Skip and Katy held each other's hands triumphantly aloft as the final notes rang out as the audience applauded
Designer: The American beauty, 32, put on a busty display in a pin-striped Versace suit with a plunging crop top as she sang the catchy pop tune

Having rocked the red carpet in an Atelier Versace look, Katy Perry changed into an Adam Selman Fall 2017 ensemble for her on-stage performance.
A fun take on tailoring, this black and pink striped blazer, trousers and crop top combo is a fab alternative to a LBD for a night out.
We also love how Katie has styled it with a pair of trainers to give this otherwise smart look an off-beat aesthetic that's perfect for the BRITs.

Satire: Giant skeletons dressed as Donald Trump and Theresa May after the Prime Minister's recent visit to the US were introduced later on in the performance, with their operators skilfully propelling them to the centre of the stage
Little Mix got the show off to a pitch perfect start as they belted out their hit Shout Out To My Ex.
Perrie Edwards, Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jade Thirlwall were carried to the stage atop thrones befitting of their status as pop royalty.
And they proceeded to deliver a typically professional performance, dressed in racy metallic ensembles.
Girl power: Little Mix have cemented themselves as the country's ultimate girl group
Sassy: Backed by a plethora of silver painted dancers, the girls performed their moves with plenty of attitude
Watch the throne: Perrie Edwards, Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jade Thirlwall were carried to the stage atop thrones befitting of their status as pop royalty
Pitch perfect: Perrie's vocals were typically on point as she belted out the girls' break-up anthem
Backed by a plethora of silver painted dancers, the girls performed their moves with plenty of attitude, no doubt getting everyone in the O2 even more excited than they already were.
The high standard continued with the funktastic Bruno Mars, who grooved his way though That's What I Like.
Flanked by his backing singers, the smooth star smiled his way through the tune in a blue and red shirt and navy trousers.
Here come the girls: The stage set up was eye-catching with a futuristic theme
Work it: Perrie set pulses racing as she performed her sexy moves
Cheeky! As the girls turned, they flashed their pert derrieres
Raise the roof: The girls were lifted into the air atop a suspended platform
The big-voiced Emeli Sandé was up next with her powerful ballad Hurts, and her voice nearly took the roof off the riverside venue.
Fresh from scooping Best British Group, The 1975 took to the stage to perform The Sound from their hit album I Like It When You Sleep, for You Are So Beautiful yet So Unaware of It.
Frontman Matt Healy got the audience in front of the stage jumping to the band's catchy pop tones.
Bringing the funk: The high standard continued with the funktastic Bruno Mars, who grooved his way though That's What I Like
Giving his all: Bruno made sure he hit all the high notes during his performance
Belt it out: The big-voiced Emeli Sandé was up next with her powerful ballad Hurts, and her voice nearly took the roof off the riverside venue
In the spotlight: Emeli cut a solitary figure on the large O2 stage
Dramatic: The performance was made even more intense by the brooding backdrop
Let's celebrate: Fresh from scooping Best British Group The 1975 took to the stage to perform The Sound from their hit album I Like It When You Sleep, for You Are So Beautiful yet So Unaware of It
Chris Martin paid an emotional tribute to the late George Michael, following a touching eulogy by the singer's former Wham! bandmates Andrew Ridgeley, Helen 'Pepsi' DeMacque and Shirlie Holliman.
Singing A Different Corner, a video of George crooning the song was played in the background, as their voices mixed for an unforgettable duet.
There was a touch of de ja vu when grime king Skepta performed his anthem Shutdown. BRITs producers repeatedly muted the audio during the track in a similar manner to when Kanye West performed All Day in 2015.
Ed Sheeran performed a medley of his two huge hits Castle On The Hill and Shape Of You, the latter of which included a blistering guest spot from Stormzy.
Emotional: Chris Martin paid an emotional tribute to the late George Michael, following a touching Eulogy by the singer's former Wham bandmates Andrew Ridgeley, Helen 'Pepsi' DeMacque and Shirlie Holliman
Heartfelt: Singing A Different Corner, a video of George crooning the song was played in the background, as their voices mixed for an unforgettable duet
There was another special collaborative performance from Coldplay and The Chainsmokers who teased Something Just Like This from the dance duo's upcoming album.
Closing the show was BRITs Global Icon Award recipient Robbie Williams who performed surrounded by scantily-clad beauties.
Earlier in the night Jade Thirlwall showed off more than she bargained for as she suffered a wardrobe malfunction on the BRITs red carpet, at London 's O2 Arena.
The 24-year-old dazzled in a floor-length gown with a thigh-high split as she arrived with her bandmates - but the slit later fell open to reveal too much as she posed for cameras.
Sound of the streets: There was a touch of de ja vu when grime king Skepta performed his anthem Shutdown
Man of the moment: Ed Sheeran performed a medley of his two huge hits Castle On The Hill and Shape Of You, the latter of which included a blistering guest spot from Stormzy
Upbeat: There was another special collaborative performance from Coldplay and The Chainsmokers who teased Something Just Like This from the dance duo's upcoming album
Man of the people: Chris jumped into the pit with the BRIT School crowd
Vibrant: The band's performance was typically colourful
Natural entertainer: Closing the show was BRITs Global Icon Award recipient Robbie Williams who performed surrounded by scantily-clad beauties
Pop icon: The singer was in his element as he brought the show to a close
The pop star looked truly stunning in a floor-length gown of soft white silk, which was both sophisticated and sexy with a plunging neckline and daring side split.
However the beauty suffered a slight wardrobe malfunction in the show-stopping frock as the slit slipped too high up her thigh - causing her to accidentally flash onlookers.
Yet, Jade soon rectified her error with the help of the rest of her team so it was only her long and lean legs beneath that were proudly on show to all.
Little Glitch! Jade showed off more than she bargained for as she suffered a wardrobe malfunction on the BRITs red carpet
Oops: The 24-year-old dazzled in a floor-length gown with a thigh-high split - but the saucy slit accidentally revealed too much as it fell open while she posed for cameras
Glamorous: Jade still managed to maintain her glamorous style however as she arrived with her bandmates Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Ann Pinnock and Perrie Edwards (L-R)
Daring: The pop star looked truly stunning in a floor-length gown of soft white silk, which was both sophisticated and sexy with a plunging neckline and daring side split
Model material: Jade soon rectified her error with the help of the rest of her team so it was only her long and lean legs beneath that were proudly on show to all
Keeping all eyes on her striking look, the South Shields native accessorised with a pair of barely-there black heels and added a trendy set of leather gloves, to give the glamorous ensemble an edgy touch.
Known for their trademark styles, Jade was of course joined by her three glamorous band mates as they posed excitedly on the red carpet.
Perrie Edwards, 23, certainly made a statement on the carpet in a raunchy black PVC dress, complete with a striking skirt of black feathers.
Minimal: Keeping all eyes on her striking look, the South Shields native accessorised with a pair of barely-there black heels
Hell for feather! Perrie Edwards, 23, certainly made a statement on the carpet in a raunchy black PVC dress, complete with a striking skirt of black feathers
Packing a punch: Upping the sex appeal, the dress then cut to an eye-wateringly short length at the front and into a low back, revealing most of her enviably leggy figure beneath
Fluffing it up: Perrie was seen adjusting her skirt on the carpet in order to make sure she did not suffer the same fate as Jade on the night
Gorgeous: Perrie styled her blonde locks into a chic side braid to display her clear, glowing skin to all
Following a risqué style, the racy material of the top pulled into a plunging sweet heart neckline to tease at her bust, before it extended into a full fluffy skirt which billowed behind her as she posed.
Upping the sex appeal further, the dress then cut to an eye-wateringly short length at the front and into a low back, revealing most of her enviably leggy figure and plenty of skin beneath.
The singer lengthened her already statuesque frame with a pair of black heeled sandals, and styled her blonde locks into a chic side braid to display her clear, glowing skin - which she accentuated with perfectly bronzed make-up.
Meanwhile Leigh-Anne opted for a somewhat edgier look as she arrived at the bash in a bold denim dress, which raunchily laced up at the sides like a corset.
Monochrome magic: Perrie and Jade dazzled onlookers as they posed side by side in their co-ordinating outfits
Hugging her figure from head to toe, the unique gown cinched in at her enviably tiny waist before it flowed out into a ripped pleated skirt of multiple denim shades.
Maintaining their typically saucy style, the dress then laced up with white corset ribbons on each side, to tease at her famously toned figure.
Leigh-Anne slicked her hair into a tight bun to show off her naturally pretty features and added a sultry, smoky eye for a glamorous finishing touch.
Gorgeous: Hugging her figure from head to toe, the unique gown cinched in at her enviably tiny waist before it flowed out into a ripped pleated skirt of multiple denim shades
Making a statement: Leigh-Anne slicked her hair into a tight bun to show off her naturally pretty features and added a sultry, smoky eye for a glamorous finishing touch
Tying their group image together was Jesy Nelson, who matched the outfits of her fellow band mates in a leather dress, complete with racy zip down the front to flash her pins despite its maxi length.
The sexy black number plunged incredibly low at the chest to reveal her cleavage, before skimming her enviably slim and womanly figure to the floor.
Completing the vixen vibe, Jesy accessorised with a grungy studded waist belt and bracelets, and styled her hair into loose, tousled curls as she posed up a storm with her girls.
